article.headline: Manhattan 97, Canisius 87
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Rashad Green, Andrew Gabriel and Darryl Crawford scored 21 points apiece, and Manhattan defeated Canisius 97-87 on Sunday to snap an eight-game losing streak. Devon Austin added 16 points and Green had 11 rebounds for the Jaspers (9-15, 3-11 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference). Antoine Pearson added 10 points. Frank Turner scored 17 points, Jovan Robinson had 16 and Rishawn Johnson 13 for the visiting Golden Griffins (4-20, 2-12). Pawel Malesa had 12 points and Julius Coles 10. Crawford had 15 points in helping Manhattan take a 46-30 lead at halftime, and Pearson's 3-pointer 4:06 into the second half propelled the Jaspers to a 60-37 lead. Coles hit a 3 with 9:14 left in the game to cap a 19-7 run for the Griffs that cut the lead to 73-61, and Turner scored with 2:03 remaining to slash the edge to 83-77. But Canisius got no closer. Manhattan scored 12 points on free throws in the final 1:25.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
